chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Alfonso Lopez III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Alfonso Lopez III is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Alfonso Lopez III was found guilty of Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While Revoked (Misdemeanor)], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Door County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: $150 fine plus costs. Cash bond applied.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Alfonso Lopez III
Current: N6084 State Highway 42, Kewaunee, WI 54216 United States  (Effective: 03-14-2016)
Prior: 3261 Nicolet Drive, Green Bay, WI 54311 United States

Defendant Alfonso  Lopez in court with attorney Peter J. Kovac.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters guilty plea to Ct. 1.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty Ct. 1. Atty Korb makes sentencing statement. Defense gives sentencing argument. Defendant apologizes to the court. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.

Defendant Alfonso  Lopez in court with attorney Peter J. Kovac who appears by phone.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Kovac indicates he didn't think the drive from Madison to Sturgeon Bay would take as long as it is, he's no where near Sturgeon Bay yet, apologizes to the court.  Court reviews events in file.  State moves to dismiss Ct. 2. Defense has no objection. Court dismisses Ct. 2, questions what's happening with Ct. 1. Atty Kovac would like some time to discuss matter with defendant and ADA Korb to resolve matter. State has no objection to adjournment. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Mr. Lopez' Motion to Dismiss Bail Jumping Charge

Attorney Peter J. Kovac appears by phone.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file. Atty Kovac indicates defendant is in the Brown County jail serving a sentence with huber privileges. Court indicates if defendant is on huber, he should be able to appear on his own, neither Door County or Brown County Sheriff will transport defendant for court. Court reviews motion faxed by Atty Kovac this morning. State has not seen that motion yet. Court reschedules matter. Defendant needs to appear in court in person for that hearing.  Status conference scheduled for January 28, 2016 at 03:45 pm.

Defendant Alfonso  Lopez in court with attorney Peter J. Kovac.  Joan Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Amended Complaint given to Defendant in Court.   Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel.  Defense waives reading of the amended complaint, Atty Kovac objects to Ct. 2, lack of venue. State explains that Door County has jurisdiction. Atty Kovac indicates defendant has been charged with Bail Jumping in Brown County also. State questions whether defendant has entered a plea in the Brown County case. Atty Kovac indicates they had court in Brown County this morning, that matter was put over for a few weeks.  Defense stands mute to the charges. Court enters not guilty plea on defendants behalf to both charges, finds probable cause for bindover. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for December 28, 2015 at 11:45 am.

Defendant Alfonso Lopez in court with attorney Peter J. Kovac who appears by phone.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Kovac indicates defendant is in the process of getting his occupational license, hopes to have that done within 30 days. Atty Kovac requests a 45 day adjournment. State indicates they are withdrawing their offer and State will be filing an amended complaint adding a bail jumping charge. Atty Kovac indicates bail jumping has already been charged in another county. Court needs to see some movement on this case. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Alfonso Lopez in court with attorney Peter J. Kovac who appears by phone.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Kovac indicates he hasn't totally been hired by defendant, not sure where matter is at. Defendant indicates he still wishes to have Atty Kovac represent him. Atty Kovac requests 60 days continuance so defendant can obtain a drivers license.  State concerned that defendant was picked up on new charges in Brown County. Atty Kovac advises where Brown County matter is at. Court puts matter back on the calendar for September. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for September 24, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Peter J. Kovac appears by phone.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file. Atty Kovac indicates defendant is in custody in Brown County. Defendant hasn't been able to reinstate his drivers license, requests time to review options with defendant. Counsel request another status in 30 days.  Status conference scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Brown Co. DA requesting copy of complaint, bond and minute sheets.

Defendant Alfonso Lopez in court.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Defendant indicates he tried calling Atty Kovac several time, hasn't gotten a call back. Defendant was advised that Atty Kovac has been ill the last week. Court reschedules matter. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for July 10, 2015 at 10:00 am.

State's Discovery Demand
Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license and subject to any conditions or restrictions on that license. To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving Justice Center.
Defendant in custody.

ADDRESS INFO for Alfonso Lopez III
Current: 232 Richard St, Waukesha, WI 53189 United States  (Effective: 04-24-2015)
Prior: 1630 Janice Ave # 11, Green Bay, WI 54304

Defendant Alfonso Lopez appeared by video conference. Attorney Peter J. Kovac appeared by phone. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charge, max. penalties, right to counsel. Defense waives reading of Complaint, stands silent as to plea. Court enters not guilty plea on Defendant's behalf. Court questions Defense on non-appearance. Defense advises of attempts to contact DA's office regarding coming in. Bond set. State advises of warrant in Brown County. Defense advises of recognizance bond in Brown County. Defendant Alfonso Lopez in court with attorney .  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Status conference scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant Alfonso Lopez not in court.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews citation issued to defendant showing mandatory appearance. State requests bench warrant based on non appearance by defendant. Court orders bench warrant.
